events.originalText: Former editor-in-chief of Hong Kong newspaper Ming Pao Kevin Lau was stabbed, prompting concerns and protests about media freedom.
events.subtitle: Ming Pao
events.headline: Former Ming Pao Editor Kevin Lau Stabbed, Media Freedom Concerns Rise

events.originalText: A hot air balloon crashed near Luxor, Egypt, killing 19 people in the deadliest ballooning disaster in history.
events.subtitle: 2013 Luxor hot air balloon crash
events.headline: Luxor Hot Air Balloon Crash Kills 19 in Deadliest Disaster

events.originalText: African-American teenager Trayvon Martin was killed by neighborhood-watch coordinator George Zimmerman in Sanford, Florida, prompting a nationwide controversy.
events.subtitle: Trayvon Martin
events.headline: Trayvon Martin Killed by George Zimmerman, Nationwide Controversy Erupts

events.originalText: In the first significant cultural visit from the United States to North Korea since the Korean War, the New York Philharmonic Orchestra performed in East Pyongyang Grand Theatre.
events.subtitle: Korean War
events.headline: New York Philharmonic Orchestra Performs in North Korea

events.originalText: In the first significant cultural visit from the United States to North Korea since the Korean War, the New York Philharmonic Orchestra performed in East Pyongyang Grand Theatre.
events.subtitle: Korean War
events.headline: Barings Bank Declared Insolvent After Trader's £827 Million Loss

events.originalText: Barings Bank, the oldest merchant bank in London, was declared insolvent after its head derivatives trader in Singapore, Nick Leeson, lost £827 million while making unauthorised trades on futures contracts.
events.subtitle: Barings Bank
events.headline: Superliner Railcar Enters Revenue Service with Amtrak

events.originalText: The Superliner railcar entered revenue service with Amtrak.
events.subtitle: Superliner (railcar)
events.headline: Imperial Japanese Army Troops Attempt Coup in Tokyo, Killing Politicians

events.originalText: Imperial Japanese Army troops attempted a coup d'etat, occupying parts of Tokyo, and killing several politicians, including finance minister Takahashi Korekiyo.
events.subtitle: Imperial Japanese Army
events.headline: Adolf Hitler Violates Treaty of Versailles, Orders Luftwaffe Reinstated

events.originalText: Adolf Hitler ordered the Luftwaffe reinstated, violating the Treaty of Versailles signed at the end of World War I.
events.subtitle: Adolf Hitler
events.headline: Scottish Engineer Demonstrates Radar Technology in Daventry

events.originalText: With the aid of a radio station in Daventry, England, and two receiving antennae, Scottish engineer and inventor Robert Watson-Watt first demonstrated the use of radar.
events.subtitle: Daventry
events.headline: Original Dixieland Jass Band Records First Jazz Single

events.originalText: The Original Dixieland Jass Band recorded "Livery Stable Blues", the first jazz single ever released.
events.subtitle: Original Dixieland Jass Band
events.headline: RMS Britannic Launched at Harland and Wolff Shipyard

events.originalText: RMS Britannic, the third and largest Olympic-class ocean liner of the White Star Line after RMS Olympic and RMS Titanic, was launched at the Harland and Wolff shipyard in Belfast.
events.subtitle: HMHS Britannic
events.headline: Napoleon Escapes Exile on Elba Island

events.originalText: Napoleon escaped from the Italian island of Elba (depicted), to which he had been exiled after the signing of the Treaty of Fontainebleau.
events.subtitle: Napoleon
events.headline: Dutch Explorer Willem Janszoon Makes First European Landing in Australia

events.originalText: Dutch explorer Willem Janszoon made the first recorded European landing in Australia, although he believed that he was on New Guinea.
events.subtitle: Willem Janszoon
events.headline: King of Sicily Manfred Killed in Battle of Benevento

events.originalText: Wars of the Guelphs and Ghibellines: Manfred, King of Sicily, was killed in the Battle of Benevento against the forces of Charles of Anjou.
events.subtitle: Guelphs and Ghibellines
events.headline: Babylonian King Nabonassar Begins Reign, Era of Chronological Records

events.originalText: According to Ptolemy, the reign of the Babylonian king Nabonassar began, marking a new era characterized by the systematic maintenance of chronologically precise historical records.
events.subtitle: 740s BC
